speaker: Doctor
text: Good morning, how have you been managing with your current medications, especially the methotrexate?

speaker: Patient
text: Hi, Doctor. I've been doing okay, but I sometimes feel a bit nauseous after taking methotrexate.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm sorry to hear that. Have you been taking your folic acid regularly? It can help with some of the side effects.

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I take it every day as you advised. It does help a bit, but the nausea still bothers me sometimes.

speaker: Doctor
text: We could consider adjusting the timing of your methotrexate dose or even the dose itself. Would you be open to trying that?

speaker: Patient
text: I’d be willing to try changing the timing. I’d prefer not to lower the dose if it’s helping my arthritis.
